channel.title: Reading variable names?
channel.description:
I don't know how to describe it properly, i have a .ini with 10 strings saved as Talk1-Talk10. and i want an easy way of calling them instead of calling them one by one.
i don't think a script is nessecary but i'll just show you a demo of what i'm doing.
[code]{the .ini [AutoTalk] Talk1=Line1 Talk2=Line2 Talk3=Line3 ...}
procedure LinesToString; begin Array[1]:=ReadINI('AutoTalk','Talk1',Path); Array[2]:=ReadINI('AutoTalk','Talk2',Path); Array[3]:=ReadINI('AutoTalk','Talk3',Path); ... end;[/code] Is there an easier way to script this?
Thanks in advance :)

item.title: Reading variable names?
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

Ahh, totally slipped my mind, ty nashi

Read full topic

item.title: Reading variable names?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

var
  i: integer;

{the .ini
[AutoTalk]
Talk1=Words
Talk2=MoreWords
Talk3=Even More Words
}

procedure LinesToString;
begin
  for i:= 1 to 10 do
  begin
    Writeln(ReadINI('AutoTalk','Talk' + IntToStr(i),Path));
  end;
end;

You were close Trilez

Read full topic

item.title: Reading variable names?
item.dc:creator: @TRiLeZ TRiLeZ
item.description:
@TRiLeZ wrote:

You could do:

var
  i: integer;

{the .ini
[AutoTalk]
Talk(i)=Line(i)
}

procedure LinesToString;
begin
  for i:= 1 to 10 do
  begin
    ReadINI('AutoTalk','Talk(i)',Path);
  end;
end;

I think that would work
Or would you want a function that you would put somewhere in the script like SayLine(i: string);?

Read full topic

item.title: Reading variable names?
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

I don’t know how to describe it properly, i have a .ini with 10 strings saved as Talk1-Talk10.
and i want an easy way of calling them instead of calling them one by one.

i don’t think a script is nessecary but i’ll just show you a demo of what i’m doing.

[code]{the .ini
[AutoTalk]
Talk1=Line1
Talk2=Line2
Talk3=Line3
…}

procedure LinesToString;
begin
Array[1]:=ReadINI(‘AutoTalk’,‘Talk1’,Path);
Array[2]:=ReadINI(‘AutoTalk’,‘Talk2’,Path);
Array[3]:=ReadINI(‘AutoTalk’,‘Talk3’,Path);
…
end;[/code]
Is there an easier way to script this?

Thanks in advance

Read full topic
